danfulea.phys

Class Phantom

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.phys.Phantom

  • public class Phantom
extends java.lang.Object
    This class simulates the human body using MIRD 5 mathematical phantom. Provides geometry to Monte Carlo engine (e.g. DoseSimCore).
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 10 APR. 2005

      Return the required initial coordinate making sure the MIRD5 phantom is hit.

      Return the thickness of bodypart in cm based on projection angle (0-360) and the z coordinates in cm.

      Return the width of bodypart in cm based on projection angle (0-360) and the z coordinates in cm.

      double getMamoTz(double w, double z)
      Using directional cosine w and z coordinate, computes the distance from the point to the base surface (top or bottom) exit (distance traveled along w direction).

      Used for mammography simulation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Phantom

        public Phantom(int mode)
        Constructor. Modes available are: MAMO_INDEX (for simulating the breast in mammography), NEWBORN_INDEX, AGE1_INDEX, AGE5_INDEX, AGE10_INDEX, AGE15_INDEX and ADULT_INDEX.
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode index

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Returns:
        the mode index

      • min

        public static double min(double a,
                         double b,
                         double c)
        Find the minimum of 3 doubles.
        Parameters:
        a - a
        b - b
        c - c
        Returns:
        the result

      • getTperp

        public double getTperp(double x,
                       double y,
                       double z,
                       int irl)
        The minimum distance from a point inside the cylinder to the cylinder surface.
        Parameters:
        x - x
        y - y
        z - z
        irl - irl not used though
        Returns:
        the result

      • getMamoTz

        public double getMamoTz(double w,
                        double z)
        Using directional cosine w and z coordinate, computes the distance from the point to the base surface (top or bottom) exit (distance traveled along w direction).
        Parameters:
        w - w
        z - z
        Returns:
        the result

      • getMamoTxy

        public double getMamoTxy(double u,
                         double v,
                         double x,
                         double y)
        Same as getMamoTz but here the distance traveled is until it exists the cylinder lateral surface. It uses directional cosines u, v and its associated coordinates x, y.
        Parameters:
        u - u
        v - v
        x - x
        y - y
        Returns:
        the result

      • setMaximumOrganDimension

        public void setMaximumOrganDimension(double organDim)
        Set breast radius in cm. Used for mammography simulation.
        Parameters:
        organDim - organDim

      • setOrganThickness

        public void setOrganThickness(double organTh)
        Set breast thickness in cm. Used for mammography simulation.
        Parameters:
        organTh - organTh

      • getOrganThickness

        public double getOrganThickness()
        Used for mammography simulation.
        Returns:
        breast thickness in cm.

      • getMaximumOrganDimension

        public double getMaximumOrganDimension()
        Used for mammography simulation.
        Returns:
        breast radius in cm.

      • getOrganMass

        @Deprecated
public double getOrganMass()
        Deprecated. 
        Used for mammography simulation.
        Returns:
        breast mass in g.

      • getEntranceTransversalArea

        public double getEntranceTransversalArea()
        Return the entrance traversal area, i.e. the breast traversal area in cm^2. Used for mammography simulation.
        Returns:
        the result

      • getVertexCoordonate

        public double getVertexCoordonate()
        Return the MIRD5 phantom vertex z-coordinate in cm (top of the head).
        Returns:
        the result

      • getOrganProjThickness

        public double getOrganProjThickness(int proj,
                                    double z)
        Given the projection index and z-coordinate, return the thickness of body-part in cm. The projection code is: none for mammography (use any int here); 0 for AP, 2 for PA, 1 for LLAT and 3 for RLAT.
        Parameters:
        proj - proj
        z - z
        Returns:
        the result.

      • getOrganProjWidth

        public double getOrganProjWidth(int proj,
                                double z)
        Given the projection index and z-coordinate, return the width of body-part in cm. The projection code is: none for mammography (use any int here); 0 for AP, 2 for PA, 1 for LLAT and 3 for RLAT.
        Parameters:
        proj - proj
        z - z
        Returns:
        the result.

      • getGeneralOrganProjThickness

        public double getGeneralOrganProjThickness(double proj,
                                           double z)
        Return the thickness of bodypart in cm based on projection angle (0-360) and the z coordinates in cm.
        Parameters:
        proj - proj in degrees (0-360)
        z - z
        Returns:
        the result

      • getGeneralOrganProjWidth

        public double getGeneralOrganProjWidth(double proj,
                                       double z)
        Return the width of bodypart in cm based on projection angle (0-360) and the z coordinates in cm.
        Parameters:
        proj - proj in degrees (0-360)
        z - z
        Returns:
        the result

      • getOrganMass

        public double getOrganMass(int indx)
        Get the MIRD5 organ mass. For mammography the result is a dummy value.
        Parameters:
        indx - indx of the organ
        Returns:
        the result

      • inWhatOrgan

        public int inWhatOrgan(double[] coord)
        Based on input coordinates, this routine find in what organ the particle is.
        Parameters:
        coord - coord
        Returns:
        the organ index.

      • getFittedCoord

        public double getFittedCoord(int proj,
                             double zinit,
                             double xy)
        Return the required initial coordinate making sure the MIRD5 phantom is hit.
        Parameters:
        proj - the projection index
        zinit - initial z coordinate
        xy - the initial x or y
        Returns:
        the required y or x

      • getGeneralFittedCoord

        public double getGeneralFittedCoord(double proj,
                                    double zinit,
                                    double xy)
        Return the required initial coordinate making sure the MIRD5 phantom is hit.
        Parameters:
        proj - the projection angle in degrees (0-360)
        zinit - initial z coordinate
        xy - the initial x or y
        Returns:
        the required y or x
